Package effects

Class Effect

java.lang.Object
effects.Effect
All Implemented Interfaces:
EngineComponent
Direct Known Subclasses:
TextFadeEffect
public abstract class Effect
extends java.lang.Object
implements EngineComponent
The Effect class is responsible for animating effects inside the game window

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected int endFrame
    The total amount of frames to be displayed to complete this effect
    protected int frame
    The current frame index to be displayed
    protected java.util.LinkedList<EffectFrame> frames
    The frames provided to this Effect.
    protected EffectController fx
    The SnakeGame EffectController, stored here to reduce calls to getEffectsController()
    protected SnakeGame gameInstance
    The SnakeGame instance this Effect is attached to
    protected int x
    The x position of the Effect
    protected int y
    The x position of the Effect

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    protected Effect​(int x, int y)
    Instantiate the Effect with the position provided.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private void destroyEffect()
    Destroy this effect by queueing it's removal via the EffectController
    void paintComponent()
    Paints the Effect by displaying the EffectFrame currently selected by frame
    protected void provideFrames​(EffectFrame[] frames)
    This method is used to provide the EffectFrame instances.
    void update​(double dt)
    Called on each update tick, advances the Effect to the next frame.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • frame

      protected int frame
      The current frame index to be displayed

    • endFrame

      protected int endFrame
      The total amount of frames to be displayed to complete this effect

    • frames

      protected final java.util.LinkedList<EffectFrame> frames
      The frames provided to this Effect. The frame at frame will be displayed

    • x

      protected final int x
      The x position of the Effect

    • y

      protected final int y
      The x position of the Effect

    • gameInstance

      protected final SnakeGame gameInstance
      The SnakeGame instance this Effect is attached to

    • fx

      protected final EffectController fx
      The SnakeGame EffectController, stored here to reduce calls to getEffectsController()

  • Constructor Details

    • Effect

      protected Effect​(int x, int y)
      Instantiate the Effect with the position provided. The SnakeGame instance is retrieved via the static SnakeGame.getGameInstance().
      Parameters:
      x - The position of the effect on the X-axis
      y - The position of the effect on the Y-axis

  • Method Details

    • provideFrames

      protected void provideFrames​(EffectFrame[] frames)
      This method is used to provide the EffectFrame instances. These frames will then be displayed based on the frame selected
      Parameters:
      frames - The list of EffectFrames to be added to the frames list
      See Also:
      frames, frame

    • update

      public void update​(double dt)
      Called on each update tick, advances the Effect to the next frame. If no frames left, the Effect is destroyed
      Specified by:
      update in interface EngineComponent
      Parameters:
      dt - The time passed since the last update

    • paintComponent

      public void paintComponent()
      Paints the Effect by displaying the EffectFrame currently selected by frame
      Specified by:
      paintComponent in interface EngineComponent
      See Also:
      frame, frames

    • destroyEffect

      private void destroyEffect()
      Destroy this effect by queueing it's removal via the EffectController
      See Also:
      EntityController
